issue.title: [Documentation] Sphinx documentation does not build with just-released Sphinx 3.0.0
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8340](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8340). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I'll add a version pin in a docs PR I'm working on, but this needs to be fixed soon

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8340?focusedCommentId=17075953) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We can survive for as long as it takes with a pinned Sphinx version

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8340?focusedCommentId=17076341) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
One problem I noticed in my local setup is `breathe` raising an error. This is already fixed upstream (https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/issues/451), but it seems the latest release is not yet on conda-forge (so installing it with eg pip locally solved it for me).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8340?focusedCommentId=17076343) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Actually, there are more breathe problems with sphinx 3: https://github.com/michaeljones/breathe/issues/490 (there is an open PR to fix it). So we will need to wait on a new breathe release anyway before we can see to use sphinx 3.0 here.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8340?focusedCommentId=17458357) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Issue resolved by pull request 11878
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11878>
